TEXT.English: Build this unit (the Filippino replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Rifleman[COLOR_REVERT]) to gain an advantage in hills and forests. It receives a first strike chance, besides receiving free Guerilla I and Woodsman I promotions. The Kaputineros are a tenacious fighters, accustomed to fighting in harsh terrain and dense forests and jungles against all those who want to take their territory.
TEXT.French: Recruter cette unité (équivalent philippin du [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]fusilier[COLOR_REVERT]) pour obtenir un avantage sur les collines ou dans les forêts. Il reçoit une première attaque, en plus des promotions 'guériila I' et 'bûcheron I'. Les kaputineros sont des guerriers tenaces, habitués à se battre en terrain marécageux, en forêt ou en jungle dense contre tout ceux qui veulent prendre leur territoire.
TEXT.German: Build this unit (the Filippino replacement for the [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Rifleman[COLOR_REVERT]) to gain an advantage in hills and forests. It receives a first strike chance, besides receiving free Guerilla I and Woodsman I promotions. The Kaputineros are a tenacious fighters, accustomed to fighting in harsh terrain and dense forests and jungles against all those who want to take their territory.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Katipunan (also known as the Katipuneros) was a Philippine revolutionary organization founded by Filipino rebels in Manila, in 1892, which aimed to gain independence from Spain. The word "Katipunan" comes from the root word "tipon", an indigenous Tagalog word, meaning: "society" or "gather". Its official revolutionary meanings are translated as Kataas-taasang, Kagalang-galangang Katipunan ng mga Anak ng Bayan (Supreme and Venerable Society of the Children of the Nation). The word were used by Filipino revolutionary rebel leaders. The word were used by Filipino revolutionary rebel leaders. Katipunan is also known by its acronym, KKK (not to be mistaken with the "Ku Klux Klan").[PARAGRAPH:1]The KKK had 3 kinds of members. The Katipon (member), the Kawal (soldier), and the Bayani (hero). Each kind of member has different passwords that are secretly used for passage during meetings or entering hideouts.

Each kind of member has different passwords that are secretly used for passage during meetings or entering hideouts.
